bill_title: provide for highway signs denominating South Dakota as the Home of the Great Sioux Nations.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for highway signs denominating South Dakota as the Home of the Lakota Sioux Nations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 31-2 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The secretary of the Department of Transportation shall, in consultation with the Transportation Commission and the Office of Tribal Governmental Relations, design, produce, and erect companion signs to be displayed in conjunction with or in proximity to any South Dakota welcome sign erected and maintained at or near the state borders along any state trunk highway. The companion signs shall indicate and emphasize the relationship and role of the Lakota people in the heritage of South Dakota and shall, at a minimum, bear the inscription, HOME OF THE LAKOTA SIOUX NATIONS. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for highway signs denominating South Dakota as the Home of the Great Sioux Nations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 31-2 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The secretary of the Department of Transportation shall, in consultation with the Transportation Commission and the Office of Tribal Governmental Relations, design, produce, and erect companion signs to be displayed in conjunction with or in proximity to any South Dakota welcome sign erected and maintained at or near the state borders along any state trunk highway. The companion signs shall indicate and emphasize the relationship and role of the Sioux people in the heritage of South Dakota and shall, at a minimum, bear the inscription, HOME OF THE GREAT SIOUX NATIONS. BILL HISTORY 1/24/00 First read in Senate and referred to Transportation. S.J. 170 1/27/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/00 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 5, NAYS 1. S.J. 219
